intro: Sphaeralcea crispifolia, commonly known as the crinkled globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its fuzzy, silver-gray foliage and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and open fields. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Sphaeralcea crispifolia is adapted to arid environments and is drought-tolerant, making it a hardy addition to xeriscapic gardens.
